q: Heroes don't need to talk about what they did.
h:
“Heroes don't need to talk about what they did.” —
W.P. Kinsella

q: A good system shortens the road to the goal.
h:
“A good system shortens the road to the goal. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.
h:
“The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
h:
“The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
h:
“Associate with people who are likely to improve you. ” —
Seneca

q: Only to the extent that we expose ourselves over and over to annihilation can that which is indestructible in us be found.
h:
“Only to the extent that we expose ourselves over and over to annihilation can that which is indestructible in us be found.” —
Pema Chodron

q: The first rule of business; treat others like they want to treat you.
h:
“The first rule of business; treat others like they want to treat you.” —
Charles Dickens

q: The cost of leadership is self-interest.
h:
“The cost of leadership is self-interest.” —
Simon Sinek

q: The fewer the words, the better the prayer.
h:
“The fewer the words, the better the prayer.” —
Martin Luther

q: He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.
h:
“He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.” —
Aristotle

q: To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.
h:
“To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
h:
“It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.” —
Tony Robbins

q: The greatest of empires, is the empire over one's self.
h:
“The greatest of empires, is the empire over one's self.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.
h:
“Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Our happiness depends on the habit of mind we cultivate.
h:
“Our happiness depends on the habit of mind we cultivate.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.
h:
“Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Happiness is only real when shared.
h:
“Happiness is only real when shared.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: Stop wasting time defending your problems and work on addressing them instead.
h:
“Stop wasting time defending your problems and work on addressing them instead.” —
Celestine Chua

q: If you cannot understand something, then you have understood it incorrectly.
h:
“If you cannot understand something, then you have understood it incorrectly.” —
Kabir

q: The heart wants what it wants - or else it does not care.
h:
“The heart wants what it wants - or else it does not care.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand - relax.
h:
“Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand - relax.” —
Osho

q: Patience expands your options. If you insist on immediate gratification, your choices are severely limited.
h:
“Patience expands your options. If you insist on immediate gratification, your choices are severely limited.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Even if you stumble and fall down, it doesn't mean you've chosen the wrong path.
h:
“Even if you stumble and fall down, it doesn't mean you've chosen the wrong path.” —
Zen Proverb

q: The path is difficult to ensure worthiness. The lazy look elsewhere, The persevering find riches.
h:
“The path is difficult to ensure worthiness. The lazy look elsewhere, The persevering find riches.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Life is a traveling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
h:
“Life is a traveling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: In order to carry a positive action, we must develop here a positive vision.
h:
“In order to carry a positive action, we must develop here a positive vision.” —
Dalai Lama

q: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
h:
“There are no shortcuts to any place worth going. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.
h:
“Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: The most creative act you will ever undertake is the act of creating yourself.
h:
“The most creative act you will ever undertake is the act of creating yourself.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Make peace within, and there will be no one who can overcome you. And no one you will wish to overcome.
h:
“Make peace within, and there will be no one who can overcome you. And no one you will wish to overcome.” —
Dan Millman

q: To forget the whole world is easy; to make the whole world forget you is hard.
h:
“To forget the whole world is easy; to make the whole world forget you is hard.” —
Zhuangzi

q: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.
h:
“Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.
h:
“Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
h:
“Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
h:
“Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.” —
Marilyn Monroe

q: It's your road, and yours alone, others may walk it with you, but no one can walk it for you.
h:
“It's your road, and yours alone, others may walk it with you, but no one can walk it for you.” —
Rumi

q: We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.
h:
“We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.” —
Gabor Mate

q: A leader leads by example, not by force.
h:
“A leader leads by example, not by force.” —
Sun Tzu

q: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.
h:
“Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Wit is educated insolence.
h:
“Wit is educated insolence.” —
Aristotle

q: Never regret your past. Rather, embrace it as the teacher that it is.
h:
“Never regret your past. Rather, embrace it as the teacher that it is.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Heal the past, live the present, dream the future.
h:
“Heal the past, live the present, dream the future.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Respect is earned by effort not age, all things age without effort.
h:
“Respect is earned by effort not age, all things age without effort.” —
C. Sean McGee

q: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have. Make the NOW the primary focus of your life.
h:
“Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have. Make the NOW the primary focus of your life. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
h:
“Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.” —
Aristotle

q: All happiness depends on courage and work.
h:
“All happiness depends on courage and work.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Like it or not, this moment is all we really have to work with.
h:
“Like it or not, this moment is all we really have to work with.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Plants grow weak without wind.
h:
“Plants grow weak without wind.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
h:
“Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.” —
Coco Chanel

q: We crave for new sensations but soon become indifferent to them. The wonders of yesterday are today common occurrences
h:
“We crave for new sensations but soon become indifferent to them. The wonders of yesterday are today common occurrences ” —
Nikola Tesla
